title.narrative: 4. STRENGTHENED CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEMS AND DATA

description.narrative: By 2020, actors in child protection are equipped with and use a functional data collection and management system to inform decision- making and monitor interventions at the communal level., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, actors in child protection are equipped with and use a functional data collection and management system to inform decision- making and monitor interventions at the communal level.

description.narrative: Building on the pilot and capacity development over the past two years, UNICEF-Burkina Faso with Tdh-Lausanne supported the Government with deployment of the Child Protection Information Management System (CPIMS ) in five regions, which allowed e-management of 1,073 cases of child abuse and deprivation. The Government through UNICEF's technical and financial support adopted and submitted the 5th and 6th State's reports on the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) to the CRC committee in Geneva. The CO also supported a conduct of three studies on CP issues including the National study on VAC which was validated and disseminated. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex
Number of reports on international instruments submitted in time
Number of studies and / or evaluations conducted on child Abuse, Violence and Exploitation
Frequency of production and dissemination of statistical yearbooks (Justice, Social action, Civil registration System)
Existence of an operational mechanism for the monitoring of child Abuse, Exploitation and Violence at municipal level
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
